bitfields.name: LIFECYCLE
bitfields.description: Lifecycle state.

values.name: BLANK
values.description: Blank

values.name: OEM_OPEN

values.name: OEM_SEC_CLOSED

values.name: OEM_RETURN

bitfields.name: DBG_EN_LOCK
bitfields.description: Debug Enable Lock.

values.name: Open
values.description: The debug access control registers remain open when jumping to customer code.

values.name: Locked
values.description: The debug access control registers are write-locked before jumping to customer code.

bitfields.name: DBG_AUTH_DIS
bitfields.description: Debug Authentication Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Debug Authentication enabled

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Debug Authentication disabled

bitfields.name: TZM_EN
bitfields.description: Trust Zone Mode Enable.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: TZ-M is disabled by default.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: TZ-M is enabled

bitfields.name: SERIAL_DIS
bitfields.description: Serial Download Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: ISP path is enabled.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: ISP path is disabled.

bitfields.name: WAKEUP_DIS
bitfields.description: Wakeup Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Boot-ROM low power wakeup is enabled.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Boot-ROM low power wakeup is disabled.

values.name: REVOKE

values.name: KEEP

values.name: REVOKE

values.name: KEEP

values.name: REVOKE

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROTK_4
bitfields.description: Revokes Root of Trust Key 4.

values.name: KEEP

values.name: REVOKE

registers.name: DBG_AUTH_VU
registers.description: These Debug Authentication Vendor Usage fuses are used by customers to restrict debug certificates. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: IMG_KEY_REVOKE
registers.description: These fuses are used to revoke image signing keys separately from root keys. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK
registers.description: RoTKTH (customer trusted root key) typically used for CM33 main flash image authentication.

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK
registers.description: 256-bit encryption key used to protect confidentiality of OEM firmware. Typically required for firmware updates using sb3 (SB3KDK).

registers.name: OEM_Enablement_Token
registers.description: RoTKTH (root key hash) typically used for radio firmware authentication. (if valid token is intended to be used by programming SECURE_PHANTOM_CONFIG fuse)

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_L1
registers.description:
Debug authentication configuration for level 1 customer.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: PIN_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Controls non-invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CM33.

values.name: DAP
values.description: Use debug authentication. DFLT bit must be zero.

values.name: DFLT
values.description: Behaviour is defined by DFLT bit.

bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CM33.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_L2
registers.description:
Debug authentication configuration for level 2 customer.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

group.name: Versions
group.description: Version counters for various software components in SoC

registers.name: SOC_VER_CNT
registers.description: Version counter for various software components in SoC. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_S_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimum secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_NS_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimum non-secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc
